story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Reliance Deep Woods land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Reliance Deep Woods? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Reliance Deep Woods scored 50 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Reliance Deep Woods?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Reliance Deep Woods. Tennessee. 65 mi. TN mountain gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Single start at 155 Ellis Creek Road with 7:30 AM rollout keeps it simple, though course marking remains nonexistent. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. Elevation. 3 out of 5. The hills sort the trained from the untrained. The Wolf Creek-McFarland climb alone spans 10 miles with "horribly steep pitches, washed out road beds, and chonky bedrock to negotiate. Climate. 3 out of 5. Pack for two seasons. Historical weather data shows average highs of 69°F and lows of 49°F, with a 47% chance of rain on any given day. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. Cherokee National Forest delivers wilderness gravel with no course marking—just you, your GPS, and Tennessee mountains. Experience. 3 out of 5. The experience justifies the entry fee. Cherokee National Forest delivers the goods—8700 feet of climbing on the long route through terrain that's definitely not champagne gravel. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Tennessee Gravel runs a proper grassroots weekend with camping, music, and beer at 155 Ellis Creek Road. Value. 3 out of 5. Reasonable price for what's offered. Two-day stage race format with camping included gives you solid weekend bang for your buck.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Regional reputation. The locals know. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Nothing special about the race execution. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Reasonable costs. Plan a modest budget. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: What Reliance Deep Woods gets right.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Chattanooga or Knoxville depending on location
Lodging: TN has moderate lodging options.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: TN Mountain Gravel. If you're in TN/Southeast and want a local mountain event. yes, it's solid. If you're from out of region. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Reliance Deep Woods isn't quite right for you. For similar regional events: other TN gravel races. For better mountain events: NC/VA gravel races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Reliance Deep Woods? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Reliance Deep Woods' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.

production_checklist: [ ] B-roll sourced (check broll_sources in each beat)
[ ] Music track selected (check BPM targets per beat)
